item.title: GUI Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I see nothing wrong with the Netbeans GUI maker, it’s useful in times of boredom when you need a quick job done. Besides of which you can use it to get the design done fast then port it to another IDE in your own code. Neaten it up, etc etc.

As far as GUIs go I don’t see much point in arguing what method is best, since at the end of the day it’s the what the programming behind the scenes does that matters. Most of you are so stuck up with wanting super efficient code, perfectly written that you forgot when the end-user receives the program all they do is run it and use it. If it works they are happy regardless of how shit your GUI may be. (Just don’t take the Microsoft approach)
